comments:
(1) Make connection to daytime server
(2) Open "Remove Monitor" view. Set "Poll Wait Interval" as 5s
(3) After a few minites, you will get some error dialogs.

The problems seem to stem from a NullPointerException as follows, which might be due to bug 166598 where Daytime fails to retrieve a proper time. The SystemTableTreeViewProvider should perhaps be safe against subsystems returning invalid values.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.rse.ui.view.SystemTableTreeViewProvider.getText(SystemTableTreeViewProvider.java:267)
	at org.eclipse.rse.ui.view.SystemTableTreeViewProvider.getColumnText(SystemTableTreeViewProvider.java:325)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer.doUpdateItem(TreeViewer.java:309)
	at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer$UpdateItemSafeRunnable.run(AbstractTreeViewer.java:95)


--------------
I don't know how to reproduce this but I've put in code to avoid the null pointer exception.  I'll mark this as fixed.

I don't see a null pointer exception. One thing I did notice though was that with the poll interval set to 5s, the daytime shown in the Remote Monitor view is always 5s behind the Remote Systems view. Is this expected?
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
